intro: Coelostegia kostermansii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing vine native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong fragrance. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
